thread.title: Michael Keaton Says 'Hidden Fences' at Golden Globes After Same Mistake Was Made Earlier in the Day
thread.title_full: Michael Keaton Says 'Hidden Fences' at Golden Globes After Same Mistake Was Made Earlier in the Day

author: Alex Ungerman
title: Michael Keaton Says 'Hidden Fences' at Golden Globes After Same Mistake Was Made Earlier in the Day
text: Michael Keaton Says 'Hidden Fences' at Golden Globes After Same Mistake Was Made Earlier in the Day by Alex Ungerman 7:03   Photo: Getty Images Whoops. While announcing Viola Davis as Best Supporting Actress for the film Fences , presenter Michael Keaton accidentally referred to the movie as "Hidden Fences," seemingly thinking of Hidden Figures , another picture this year that stars a primarily African-American cast. Michael Keaton called 'Hidden Figures''Hidden Fences'. Chile! #GoldenGlobes pic.twitter.com/9vGekBQg7x Strangely enough, the same mistake was made earlier in the night by NBC's Jenna Bush Hager, who asked Pharrell Williams about "Hidden Fences" on the red carpet. "you're nominated for Hidden Fences" pic.twitter.com/7My6dtEkbG â€” Dave Itzkoff (@ditzkoff) January 9, 2017 Twitter was quick to react to the two flubs, some in jest: I loved Hidden Managers, couldn't find a single manager in it PICS: Golden Globes 2017: All the Parties! While others argued the mistake is sadly indicative of the lack of diversity in Hollywood. "The whole 'Hidden Fences' thing is actually a big deal," tweeted Carina MacKenzie, writer for The Originals . "A slip-up that's so, so indicative of the biggest problem in Hollywood." The whole "Hidden Fences" thing is actually a big deal. A slip-up that's so, so indicative of the biggest problem in Hollywood.
